de.devbliss.apitester

Class ApiTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.devbliss.apitester.ApiTest

  • public class ApiTest
extends Object
    Entrypoint class for performing api calls. It keeps the teststate including http client instance so your client side session, cookies etc. should be kept as long as you use the same ApiTest instance. You may use this either as superclass for your own tests or instantiate it within your tests if you need a different superclass for whatever reason.

    Instantiation

    • If you want to instantiate this class and use the default factories, just make:
      ApiTest api = new ApiTest();

    • If you want to instantiate this class and use specific factories (like mocks for example), just make:
      ApiTest api = new ApiTest();
      api.setGetFactory(new SpecificGetFactory());

    • If you use Guice and want to inject this class, there are two use cases:
      • if you need the default factories, you do not have to do anything since Guice is going to use the default constructor of ApiTest.
      • if you need some specifics factories, you just have to bind these factories in your Guice module like this:
        bind(DeleteFactory.class).annotatedWith(Names.named(ApiTest.DELETE_FACTORY)).to( DeleteImpl.class);
        Guice will then find this binding and call the corresponding setter function (annotated with @Injected(optional=true)).
    Author:
    hschuetz, mreinwarth, bmary, mbankmann

      • post

        public Context post(URI uri,
           Object payload,
           PostFactory postFactory,
           Map<String,String> additionalHeaders)
             throws IOException
        Performs a post request using the given PostFactory and the TestState of this instance. The PostFactory will be used for this call only. If you want to configure a new default one use setDefaultPostFactory(PostFactory). For adding headers you don't need to create a new Factory and just use the parameter.

        postFactory -

        additionalHeaders -
